instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.LP8550: What is LP8550? This is an LED driver responsible for creating the backlight on the LCD screen of Macbooks from 2011 through 2015.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No backlight brightness control.
threads.message:
Originally had liquid damage. Swapped the LED Driver.
Worked okay.

Now the backlight is either full brightness, or anything else and it's off.

Guessing some sort of PWM issue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No backlight brightness control.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No backlight brightness control.
threads.message:
I already replaced <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP>.

Is there a way to measure it?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No backlight brightness control.
threads.message: Measure what PWM is doing. But this usually happens when something is shorted together under the <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP> or a reistor/cap around it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No backlight brightness control.
threads.message:
Measure PWM with an oscilloscope?

My DMM is telling me it's 1.46v which I guess is an average of the pulses.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No backlight brightness control.
threads.message: Did you replace the <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP> again, did you check for solder blobs/shorts on the components around it? At full brightness PWM should be 3V+

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No backlight brightness control.
threads.message:
I haven't replaced it again, have finally run out of LP8550s.

For some reason nearly every job the last ten days has been <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP> related one way or another.
